meanings.definition: The process of becoming brittle or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The embrittlement of the metal was evident after years of exposure to harsh chemicals.
meanings.sent2: The embrittlement of the glass was a result of sudden temperature changes.
meanings.sent3: The embrittlement of the cookie made it crumble into pieces with just a touch.
meanings.sent4: The embrittlement of trust in their relationship caused it to shatter like fragile glass.
meanings.sent5: The embrittlement of the old book's pages made them tear easily at the slightest movement.

meanings.definition: The act of making something brittle or fragile.
meanings.sent1: The embrittlement of the wood was intentional to create a delicate sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The embrittlement of the plastic was a result of exposure to sunlight over time.
meanings.sent3: The embrittlement of the ice cream cone made it break apart before reaching the table.
meanings.sent4: The embrittlement of the relationship was caused by constant arguments that weakened its foundation.
meanings.sent5: The embrittlement of the rope made it snap under the weight of the heavy load.
